Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a brown pottery vessel, the lower section of which is grooved, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is spotted with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Curator's comments: This ostracon is a palimpsest (if the word can properly be used in this connection), an earlier text having been washed out. Many individual letters are still visible, but no consecutive sense can be made out.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.185)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36433) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36433)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 291 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13479 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
